comments.text:
Created attachment 571362
download error message

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0

This issue occurs on linux.

STR:
1. Install and run Firefox7Beta6.
2. Download a large file.
3. Upgrade to Firefox8 Beta6 while the download is in progress-use About:Firefox from Help. (the download window has disappeared after the upgrade is complete)
4. Select Tools-Downloads after the upgrade has been made.
5. Resume the file that is paused.

Expected results: the download should resume.

Actual result: an error occurs after resuming the download.
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0

This issue occurs on linux.

STR:
1. Install and run Firefox7Beta6.
2. Download a large file.
3. Upgrade to Firefox8 Beta6 while the download is in progress-use About:Firefox from Help. (the download window has disappeared after the upgrade is complete)
4. Select Tools-Downloads after the upgrade has been made.
5. Resume the file that is paused.

Expected results: the download should resume.

Actual result: an error occurs after resuming the download.

comments.raw_text: Virgil, could you check if this is a dupe? It sounds like it could be a dupe of an existing bug found in previous MU test runs.
comments.text: Virgil, could you check if this is a dupe? It sounds like it could be a dupe of an existing bug found in previous MU test runs.

comments.text:
I've searched before reporting and searched again today, but couldn't find anything related. There were some reports in the Manual update test run from 3.6 to 4 on windows, but no bugs were linked in the spreadsheet. While on linux, the result was Pass for this test.

Will try to manual update from other Firefox versions and search on other OSs later in the day.

comments.raw_text:
Can't seem to reproduce every time now, but occurred when attempting to update a Nightly with a downloaded file from  http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/nightly/latest-trunk/

Didn't occur for any other files (tried with popular downloadable installers (Acrobat, Winamp))
